Topic.Title: Newz print readz: "YELLEN SAID TO BE OBAMA’S NOMINEE TO BE CHIEF OF FED "

Message.Msg: But gold will get monkeyhammered, just cause they can... The unlimited leverage pain trade is going to lead to violent collapse. It's already gone on for far too long. As long as the keep pressing the anti-fundamental pain trade, trust will be destroyed. And a market economy cannot function absent trust. Remember when I asked what happens when demand asymptotically approaches zero? We will find out soon enough... $85B a month in QE isn't enough to support outflows from market of people having to sell investments to bridge income gaps. Janet is going to have to take 'er up to about $150B to keep the ascent going...

Message.Title: Amazon desperately pushing Prime...Kindle HDX lowly #11 in electronics.
Message.Msg: Hey AMZN pumpers, I contributed to your cause today. I bought the #1 selling Electronics product on Amazon today.... Google Chromecast. $35 with free super saver shipping. It asked me about 10 times if I wanted to try Prime. Seriously. Must need more unearned revenues to boost its cash position... I suppose given that the Kindle HDX is ranked #11 right now (below all the older discounted Kindle Fire versions), looks like Amazon is going to have some awfully bad Q3 YOY comps given the relative success of last year's full product line refresh.

Message.Title: $280 is in sight.
Message.Msg: Wow. AMZN: the greatest stock in the Universe.

Why would I be sad? I shorted at $300 and was underwater when it hit $320. I think Amazon is a great company, just grossly overpriced at these levels. In fact, I purchased 3 books from them this morning. This stock has had a terrific run and it's been a monumental momentum trade. I took a chance being short at the end of the 3rd quarter, as a number of fund managers bought in simply for window dressing. I have no idea where this stock is headed, but my gut tells me it will be a very long time before they make any real money. Of course...earnings don't matter to some people....obviously. Message.Title: Hmmm, what's "sybs" end game goal posting here?
Message.Msg: After reading and analyzing many of his posts, I have drawn the following conclusion from his posts as to what his "end game goal" is with all of this posts here, though I could be proven wrong. One may think that the purpose of all of his many posts is to somehow have an influence on the stock price action so he can end up making a profit. Well, we all know that can't be. Nobody can influence the stock price by posting here. Why not? Because the stock price bid-ask action is controlled by the largest shareholding and money holding institutions and moved at their discretion. It is thus silly to think that by an individual trader's comments on a message board that an institution is going to read said comments and then act on the basis of such a post. So what is his purpose in posting here? To make himself look like a famous guru to a bunch of total strangers on a message board whom he will never meet in person? Not likely, and kind of a waste of time, right? So, what I think that his end game goal is is that he wants to prove to anyone who reads his posts that he will be ultimately "right," not so much about his ability to make a profit (like, big deal if he does, i.e. who cares?). Rather, his ultimate goal is to claim that he is right about the "economic disaster" situation, i.e. if and when stocks do collapse, he will then claim to be a genius, and then proceed to his real goal: Once he's "proven right" he will then get everyone if his readers to say, "wow, what a genius sybs is," and then he'll go on to promote his real end game goal of blaming the Jews for the disaster. Continued...

Message.Title: Retail visionary
Message.Msg: Retail visionary Jeff Bezos was asked in a recent interview what direction Amazon would take once the worldwide expansion of fulfillment centers was complete. "We have come to understand that there is a large % of Amazon shoppers who would prefer to handle and perhaps even try out merchandise prior to making a purchase. For some inexplicable reason the numbers of places where they can actually do this has declined recently. To that end we have decided to embark on the construction of "shopping centers" where buyers can actually handle the merchandise. For those individuals wishing to avoid the wait of same day delivery they will actually be able to take the merchandise with them. The centers will be branded under the name Firemart. This expansion will of course impact our near term profitability but should have a positive impact on revenues."
